intro: Oxydectes novi-friburgi, commonly known as the New Friburg dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Oxydectes novi-friburgi is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
